item.description:
NOTE: Donation not needed if you bring food and/or drink.

Hi everyone!

It's that time of year again, where the remaining Bostonians that have survived the long winter come out of hibernation and remember what it was like to wear shorts and tank tops all those months (years?) ago.

It's also a very important time of year in Japan - ohanami! For those of you new to ohanami, it's the long-established tradition of cherry blossom viewing in Japan, where people can relax, eat, and drink under the beautiful cherry trees located all over Japan. We also have cherry trees spread throughout Boston (many donated by Japan), so why not join us for own ohanami picnic?

When:
Please watch this section carefully since we are contending with rain this weekend.
As of now, we will be meeting on Sunday, but if we get rained out, we will plan on the next weekend.

Location/Directions:
We will meet near the bridge that crosses the pond with the swan boats ('Meeting Place Option 1' on the map). Please look for signs on the trees where we will be located.

http://www.mit.edu/~r...

What to Bring:
- Some type of food or drink, whether it's something homemade or bought from the store. Please leave a note on this event page indicating what you will bring.
- If you can't bring food or drink, please bring a $5 donation to help cover expenses and the extra food and snacks I will pick up on your behalf.
- If you have it, a soccer ball, frisbee, or anything else you would like for playing over in Boston Commons

Keep checking this event page for updates.
item.how_to_find_us: We will have meetup signs posted on a couple trees ... look for us!
item.name: ~Ohanami~ (Cherry Blossom Viewing)
